channel.title: Data Structures on SNR R User Group
channel.description: Recent content in Data Structures on SNR R User Group

item.title: Getting to know R: more about data types
item.description: # .libPaths("P:/RLibrary") options(stringsAsFactors = TRUE, warn = 0) knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE) Data Structures Vectors numbers, characters, logical mixed types of data 1 dimension create this using c() or vector() vect <- c(letters[1:26]) # create a vector vect ## [1] "a" "b" "c" "d" "e" "f" "g" "h" "i" "j" "k" "l" "m" "n" "o" "p" "q" ## [18] "r" "s" "t" "u" "v" "w" "x" "y" "z" length(vect) # how many objects are in the vector ## [1] 26 There are a couple of different ways to look at the structure of objects
